message.content: Search the web for "Premiere Pro UXP API rename clip on timeline" or "Premiere Pro UXP TrackItem setName". Find the correct method to rename/label a clip (TrackItem) on the timeline in Premiere Pro's UXP scripting API. The clip object has these methods: createSetNameAction, getName, getProjectItem. Setting projectItem.name doesn't update the timeline display. What's the correct approach?

input.query: Premiere Pro UXP API rename clip on timeline TrackItem setName createSetNameAction
Premiere Pro UXP scripting API TrackItem name label 2024 2025

Based on my search, I found relevant information about renaming clips on the timeline in Premiere Pro using the UXP API.

## Premiere Pro UXP API - Renaming Clips on Timeline

### TrackItem.createSetNameAction()

The Premiere Pro UXP API includes a `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` method on TrackItem objects that "returns an action that renames the trackItem."(no content)This method is available on both audio and video track items.

### How It Works

The UXP API uses an action-based pattern for modifying timeline elements:

1. An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, which blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

2. You create an action using `createSetNameAction()`, then execute it using the action execution system.

### Related Methods

For ProjectItems, there's also a `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` that "returns action that renames projectItem."

### Community Discussion

Some developers have noted that they had old CEP scripts for renaming clips on the timeline, and initially couldn't find equivalent functionality in UXP.(no content)One developer noted that simply renaming the project item associated with the clip won't work when clips share the same source footage - which is why the TrackItem-specific `createSetNameAction` is important.

### Action Execution Pattern

When using action methods like `createSetNameAction`, you need to use `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction` for the actions to work properly.

### Documentation Resources

- UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications, powered by a modern JavaScript engine that offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.
- The official API documentation is available at [developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/)
- The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin shows how to clone and remove track items and is a good starting point for integrations.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search results, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP scripting API and TrackItem name/label properties for 2024-2025:

## Current State of Premiere Pro UXP Extensibility

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform).(no content)ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.(no content)On Dec 5th, 2024, Adobe opened their public beta for UXP Plugins in Premiere Pro.

## TrackItem Object in the API

The TrackItem object represents an item on a video or audio track, within a Sequence object.

Key TrackItem properties documented include:
- Components associated with the trackItem, which can include intrinsic transformations, as well as video and audio effects.
- The duration of the trackItem (Time object, read-only).
- The visible end time of the trackItem in the sequence, relative to the beginning of its corresponding sequence.

## Working with TrackItem Name

Sample code shows accessing trackItem.name property, such as: 'onActiveSequenceTrackItemAdded: ' + track.name + ' : ' + trackItem.name + ' : ' + trackItem.nodeId

## Getting Selected TrackItems (UXP)

A getSelection() method returns currently-selected clips as an Array of TrackItems, and combined with app.bind, developers can get real-time events of what the selected item is set to.

## UXP API Documentation and Resources

UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.(no content)An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread.(no content)The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/

## Current Limitations

There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.(no content)UXP in Premiere Pro is still in beta at this point, so there are lots of features/functions that either don't exist or don't fully work as needed.

For the most up-to-date and complete documentation on TrackItem properties including `name` and `label`, I recommend checking Adobe's official UXP API documentation at developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Extract all information about how to rename clips in Premiere Pro UXP API, including any code examples for createSetNameAction, executeTransaction, lockedAccess, or any other methods for renaming TrackItems on the timeline.

Find documentation for TrackItem.createSetNameAction, getName, setName, or any methods related to renaming clips on the timeline. Also look for how to execute actions using executeTransaction or lockedAccess.

content.content:
# Renaming Clips in Premiere Pro UXP API

Based on the forum discussion provided, here's what's known about this functionality:

## Current Status

The UXP API currently **does not support renaming timeline clips**. As one developer stated: "there is an entry exposed for `getName` but not `setName.`"

## Limitation

You can only read clip names using `getName()`, but there is no corresponding method to set or rename clips through the UXP API at this time.

## What Doesn't Work

Simply renaming the associated project item is insufficient because "some clips will share the same source footage," making individual timeline clip renaming necessary.

## Workarounds

**No official workarounds exist** according to the Adobe representative. The suggestion to call ExtendScript as an alternative was not confirmed as viable.

## Future Availability

Adobe indicated the `setName` functionality "will be included in the next UXP update," though no specific release date was provided as of the forum discussion (June 2025).

## Recommendation

If you require this functionality immediately, you may need to continue using legacy CEP scripts while awaiting the UXP update.

input.prompt: Find TrackItem interface or class definition, looking for createSetNameAction, setName, getName, or any methods related to renaming clips. Also look for Action execution patterns.

content.content:
# TrackItem Rename Methods in UXP Premiere Pro

Based on the TypeScript definitions provided, here are the relevant methods for renaming track items:

## AudioClipTrackItem
```typescript
createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action
//Returns an action that renames the trackItem
```

## VideoClipTrackItem
```typescript
createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action
//Returns an action that renames the trackItem
```

## Action Execution Pattern

Both audio and video track items use the same pattern:
1. Call `createSetNameAction(newName)` to create an action
2. Execute the action through the project's transaction system

The framework doesn't expose direct `setName()` or `getName()` methods. Instead, it follows an **action-based pattern** where you create immutable action objects, then execute them via `Project.executeTransaction()`.

**Key insight:** "Returns an action that renames the trackItem" indicates this is part of Premiere Pro's undo/redo system—the action object encapsulates the rename operation for safe execution and transaction management.

content.content:
# Search Results for createSetNameAction and TrackItem Renaming

Based on the provided GitHub repository content, **there are no code examples or documentation visible** showing how to use `createSetNameAction` on TrackItems, or examples demonstrating `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction` for renaming clips on the timeline.

The repository contains:
- A README with setup instructions for UXP plugin development in Premiere Pro
- References to the "Premiere Pro UXP API documentation" available at developer.adobe.com
- Sample panel code structure

**To find these specific examples, you would need to:**

1. Consult the official Premiere Pro UXP API documentation directly at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/
2. Examine the actual sample code files within the `sample-panels/premiere-api/html` directory (not shown in the provided content)
3. Check Adobe's official developer resources for transaction and locking patterns

The repository appears to be a starter template rather than comprehensive API documentation.

Links: [{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"VideoClipTrackItem","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/videocliptrackitem/"},{"title":"Premiere API—UXP for Adobe Premiere","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"},{"title":"Premiere and UXP","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/"},{"title":"UXP Arrives in Premiere: A New Era for Plugin Development","url":"https://blog.developer.adobe.com/en/publish/2025/12/uxp-arrives-in-premiere-a-new-era-for-plugin-development"},{"title":"Building your first UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/"},{"title":"Utils","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/utils/"},{"title":"Understanding UXP APIs","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/resources/fundamentals/apis/"},{"title":"Get started - UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/getting-started/"},{"title":"Essential Development Tools for UXP","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/essentials/dev-tools/"}]

Based on the search results, I found information about the Premiere Pro UXP API and the VideoClipTrackItem class, but the specific `createSetNameAction` method was not detailed in the search results. Here's what I found:

The **VideoClipTrackItem** class documentation on developer.adobe.com mentions it can "Create add transition action for sequence" and "Returns an action that moves the inPoint of the track item to a new time, by shifting it by a number of seconds."

The search results provide general information about UXP in Premiere Pro:

- UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.

- UXP is the current extensibility standard for Adobe Creative Cloud applications, supported by a constantly growing set of applications, including Premiere (version 25.6), Photoshop, and InDesign.

- An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while they were executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous, and does not block the UI thread.

The direct documentation for the VideoClipTrackItem class can be found at: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/videocliptrackitem/

However, the specific `createSetNameAction` method details were not included in the search snippet. You may want to visit the VideoClipTrackItem documentation page directly to see the full list of available methods including `createSetNameAction`.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.
